item.title: Configurator
item.description:
<style>
    label, select, input {
      display: block;
      margin: 10px 0;
      width: 100%;
    }
    button {
      margin-top: 20px;
      padding: 10px;
    }
  </style>

<label>Pilot Name:
    <input type="text" id="pilot_name" />
  </label>

  <label>Glider Type:
    <input type="text" id="glider_type" />
  </label>

  <label>Startup Volume:
    <select id="startup_volume">
      <option>Mute</option>
      <option>Low</option>
      <option selected>Medium</option>
      <option>High</option>
      <option>Full</option>
    </select>
  </label>

  <label>UTC Time Offset:
    <select id="utc_time_offset">
      <option>-0200</option>
      <option>-0100</option>
      <option>0000</option>
      <option>+0100</option>
      <option selected>+0200</option>
    </select>
  </label>

  <label>Display Version (1 to 3):
    <input type="number" id="display_version" min="1" max="3" value="1" />
  </label>

  <label>Climb Threshold:
    <input type="number" id="climb_threshold" min="0" max="10" value="0.2" />
  </label>

  <label>Sink Threshold:
    <input type="number" id="sink_threshold" min="-10" max="0" value="-2.0" />
  </label>

  <label>Shutdown Information:
    <input type="text" id="shutdown_information" />
  </label>



  <button onclick="generateConfig()">Download Config</button>


  <script>
    function generateConfig() {
      const config = {
        pilot_name: document.getElementById('pilot_name').value,
        glider_type: document.getElementById('glider_type').value,
        startup_volume: document.getElementById('startup_volume').value,
        utc_time_offset: document.getElementById('utc_time_offset').value,

        climb_threshold: Number (parseFloat( document.getElementById('climb_threshold').value).toFixed(1)) ,
        sink_threshold: Number (parseFloat( document.getElementById('sink_threshold').value).toFixed(1)) ,
        shutdown_information: document.getElementById('shutdown_information').value,
      };

      const displayVersion = document.getElementById('display_version').value;
      if (displayVersion && parseInt(displayVersion) >= 1 && parseInt(displayVersion) <= 3) {
        config.display_version = parseInt(displayVersion);
      }

      const jsonString = JSON.stringify(config, null, 2);
      const blob = new Blob([jsonString], { type: 'text/plain' });
      const link = document.createElement('a');
      link.href = URL.createObjectURL(blob);
      link.download = 'config.txt';
      link.click();
    }
  </script>

item.title: Software
item.description:
• Firmware written in RUST, providing great memory safety, fast code execution and a broad compatibility and easy to ugprade
    • just drag and drop a firmware file to the USB connected vario from your PC or mobile
  • Numerical Variometer on the display
  • Altitude aMSL
  • Altitude above Ground (using SRTM elevation data)
  • Groundspeed and Glideratio
  • Compass with flight direction
  • Windspeed- and direction estimator
  • FAI CIVL approved IGC tracklog signing (G-record)
  • Flight and Landing detection, Flighttimer and Post-Flight Statistics

Developer quickstart:

  1. Install the Rust toolchain using rustup: https://rustup.rs/.
  2. Install the nightly toolchain and add the target to build for the RP2040:
rustup toolchain install nightly
rustup target add thumbv6m-none-eabi
  1. To build the firmware to flash it via the BOOTSEL mode, you need elf2uf2-rs:
cargo install elf2uf2-rs
  1. To build the firmware to flash it with the BOOTSEL mode, from the firmware folder run:
cargo build --release
elf2uf2-rs ./target/thumbv6m-none-eabi/release/ep-vario-firmware ep-vario-firmware.uf2

With the EPVario turned off, connect it to your computer using a USB-C cable. Hold the Up button and press and hold the power button for 2 seconds. A mass storage device should show up on your computer. Drag and drop the ep-vario-firmware.uf2 file that was just created to the device. It will automatically dismount the device and install the firmware.

item.title: Hardware
item.description:
Hardware Features:

  • RP2040, dual-core Arm Cortex-M0+ processor
  • power saving Epaper, WeAct Studio 2.9 Inch Epaper Module
  • 3.3V architecture using TPS6303 voltage regulator
  • L5M6DS3 IMU for accelerometer and gyro data fusion
  • BMP280 pressure sensor
  • M10UBX GPS module (supporting GLONASS, BDSB, GALILEO, SBAS, QZSS)
  • QMC5883 compass
  • MicroSD cardslot for flight path logging
  • 1W speaker for excellent acustic (30x20cm)
  • USB-C connector
  • MAX90357AEWL+T speaker amplifier
  • integrated 1100mAh Lipo
  • USB-C lipo charger (MCP73871)
  • user interface with 3 buttons
  • compact size and low weight
  • 3D printed case with multiple attachment options
  • 80-85g
  • more than 15h runtime

Part list:

  • epVario PCB
  • WeAct Studio 2.9" EPaper Module
  • Walksnail WS-M181 GPS + compass
  • EEMB LP603449 1100mAh lipo battery (51x35x6.3mm)
  • Adafruit 4227 1W 8 Ohm Speaker or similiar (30x20mm)
  • microSD card, not larger than 32GB (preferably SanDisk)
  • 3D printed case
